channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: Headquarters built to house thousands of staff might be a "thing of the past" if social distancing means only two people can take the lift at a time, says the boss of Barclays.
item.title: Bankers won't be returning to office towers anytime soon

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: state prepares to ease restrictions

item.description: Australia's Hannah Green will get to keep her PGA Championship trophy at least until October after the year's first scheduled major was postponed because of the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: Women's PGA Championship moved to October

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Scott Morrison urges further downloads of COVIDSafe, global COVID-19 infections climb past 3.1 million as nation's death toll stands at 91

item.description: Brisbane Lions coach Chris Fagan says players need to "suck it up" and do what's right for the game as the AFL attempts to reboot the premiership season in quarantine hubs.
item.title: Players must 'suck it up' on AFL hubs, says Lions coach

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: Billionaire Andrew "Twiggy" Forrest-backed mining giant Fortescue Metals has hiked its iron ore shipments target for the June quarter.
item.title: 'Twiggy' Forrest's Fortescue eyes export growth as China recovers

item.description: British World War II veteran Captain Tom Moore, the national hero who raising almost £30 million ($55 million) for the health service, celebrates his 100th birthday on Thursday with an honorary promotion and two military fly-pasts.
item.title: Britain's fund-raising hero promoted to 'Colonel' Tom for his 100th birthday

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: ANZ Bank has suspended its dividend due to the coronavirus crisis, as the lender took a $1 billion charge in anticipation of a wave of bad loans.
item.title: ANZ suspends dividend as profits tumble 60 per cent

item.description: Cruise ship identified as source of a Tasmanian outbreak as the state records another death.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Justin Rake
item.description: A Mandurah school principal has been stood down pending an investigation overnight after urging parents to keep their children home despite the state government's decision to reopen schools this week.
item.title: WA principal stood down after urging parents to keep children home

item.dc:creator: Fran Rimrod
item.description: Andrew Forrest said there were no surprises at the press conference, calling the entire saga “the biggest beat-up ever”.
item.title: WA coronavirus LIVE: WA mining mogul Andrew 'Twiggy' Forrest denies press conference ambush

item.description: The announcement by Johnson and his fiancee, Carrie Symonds, that she gave birth to a healthy baby added a joyful milestone to a year of dizzying events.
item.title: For Boris Johnson, a baby boy during a busy year of highs and lows

item.dc:creator: Max Koslowski
item.description: Long-time federal Labor politician Mike Kelly will resign from Parliament after months of ill health, leaving his marginal NSW seat vulnerable to capture by the Morrison government.
item.title: Labor MP Mike Kelly announces resignation from Parliament

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Major supermarket Woolworths has failed to keep pace with rival Coles as the coronavirus sets off a wave of panic buying in supermarkets
item.title: Woolworths trailing Coles in coronavirus panic buying race as sales rise 10.3pc

item.dc:creator: David Scutt
item.description: US corporate earnings, speculation over continued central bank support, window dressing and virus treatment hopes combine to boost global equities.
item.title: ASX gains in early trade, ANZ and Woolworths slide following updates

item.description: Microsoft Corp. said quarterly sales and profit rose, buoyed by demand for internet-based software and cloud services needed in the shift to remote working during the coronavirus crisis.
item.title: Microsoft sales rise as working from home buoys demand

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: Media mogul Kerry Stokes has used the front page of The West Australian newspaper to call on the Scott Morrison to "quell" China's anger over a coronavirus inquiry.
item.title: Kerry Stokes calls for China backdown, urges Canberra to 'respect' wet markets

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, April 30, 2020

item.dc:creator: Roy Masters
item.description: In his dreams, a seriously ill Sydney man, Ross Campbell, has a round of golf regularly with the 2013 Masters champion Adam Scott. So Mr Campbell was delighted to find Scott on the other end of the phone.
item.title: No cameras, no trophies, but Adam Scott just won the lockdown's act of kindness award

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: Thousands of Australians working in hospitals across Britain are enduring physically gruelling and emotionally draining shifts.
item.title: Say it with lamingtons: Australian medicos on London's frontline get a taste of home

item.dc:creator: David Prestipino
item.description: Three Fremantle Dockers will face the music after they were caught out drinking at a house party that appeared to flout WA's strict social distancing rules just hours before they were relaxed.
item.title: Freo trio to face the music after Perth house party footage emerges

item.dc:creator: David Prestipino
item.description: WA's plan for hospitality venues to reopen with a clean slate has not washed down well with every business and operator, with funding for some while others are left out to dry.
item.title: Hospitality recovery plan leaves sour taste in mouths of WA's smaller players

item.dc:creator: Hamish Hastie
item.description: In WA individuals and businesses are putting their unique talents to use in the fight against the virus.
item.title: 'Think MASH, not Grey’s Anatomy': West Australian ingenuity shines in COVID-19 fight

item.description: The Australian sharemarket is set for a strong open after global markets surged overnight, buoyed by encouraging news for an experimental COVID-19 treatment that helped investors shrug off bleak US economic data.
item.title: 8@eight: ASX to rally after Wall Street soars on hopes for COVID-19 drug

item.description: Major studies into the impact of COVID-19 on young children suggest they "do not play a significant role" in spreading the virus.
item.title: Experts fail to find a single case of children passing virus to adults

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: It took about seven hours to remove the charred truck from the motorway and repair the road.
item.title: Truck hits guard rail, catches fire on Gateway Motorway in Brisbane's north

item.description: Since the coronavirus started to spread, the Tesla chief has peddled the drug chloroquine before clinical tests and questioned the ongoing need for stay-at-home orders - while touting his own relief efforts
item.title: 'Free America now!' Elon Musk goes erratic again in COVID-19 pandemic

item.description: The NSW coach says off and on-field factors play a part in all of his selections and that the trio have dented their prospects, even six months out.
item.title: I wouldn't pick them: Fittler slams Origin stars' behaviour

item.description: The program will pull together private pharmaceutical companies, government agencies and the military to try to cut the development time for a vaccine.
item.title: Trump's 'Operation Warp Speed' aims to rush coronavirus vaccine

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: Investigations quickly led detectives to a nearby home where a 50-year-old man was arrested.
item.title: Woman killed in alleged domestic violence murder north of Brisbane

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: The four men have been described as Caucasian and all wearing black clothing. They fled the scene in a black hatchback.
item.title: Man shot in Brisbane's south in serious condition, four attackers on the run

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Researchers have studied the association between mental and physical illnesses in millions of people, creating a map of the links for clinicians to use.
item.title: Researchers map links between mental and physical illnesses

item.description: The US central bank has vowed to do what it can to insulate the US economy as the coronavirus lockdowns take a severe toll on growth, underlining it will keep interest rates near zero until a recovery is well underway.
item.title: Fed pledges to use 'full range' of tools to combat virus disruptions

item.description: World stock markets surged overnight as encouraging news for an experimental COVID-19 treatment helped shrug off bleak US economic data and words of warnings from the Federal Reserve.
item.title: Global sharemarkets jump on coronavirus drug hopes, oil surges

item.description: Trump must name members of the transition council and a senior White House employee to chair it no later than six months before Election Day, which is Sunday.
item.title: Just in case: Donald Trump to prep for transition in the event he loses

item.description: One writer described the expert's style as 1950's contemporary classic, feminine and pulled-together, which stands out in Washington.
item.title: Dr Deborah Birx's scarves earn her pop culture star status

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: The pandemic is also on course to claim more civilian lives in Britain than the Blitz of World War II.
item.title: Britain's official coronavirus death toll tracking even worse than Italy's

item.description: Bill de Blasio oversaw the dispersal of a large, tightly packed Hasidic Jewish funeral and lashed out at the mourners who had gathered in defiance of social distancing rules.
item.title: New York City mayor lashes out at mourners at large Jewish funeral during pandemic

item.description: The 12-year-old girl was allegedly abducted from a Sydney skate park and taken to a home where she was sexually assaulted, police say.
item.title: Man charged over alleged abduction, sexual assault of Sydney schoolgirl

item.description: An experimental drug has proved effective against the new coronavirus in a major study, shortening the time it takes for patients to recover, US government and company officials have announced.
item.title: Gilead drug helps coronavirus patients in US study, raising hopes in pandemic fight

item.description: The drop in the January-March quarter will be only a precursor of a far grimmer report to come on the current April-June period, experts warn.
item.title: US economy shrank 4.8 per cent last quarter, with worst yet to come

item.dc:creator: Tim Biggs
item.description: Streets of Rage 4 celebrates the '90s Sega franchise while also adapting the influential visuals, music and gameplay for 2020.
item.title: Iconic brawler hits the streets again after 26 years

item.description: It's no surprise Evel Knievel spent his life with the kind of characters you couldn't make up.
item.title: What's on TV: Tuesday, May 5

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: Westpac's $150 million venture capital unit Reinventure says it could explore using external sources of capital for its next fund.
item.title: Westpac's Reinventure mulls bringing in external capital

item.description: Getting into a Zoom call is easy. Then the awkwardness sets in. And, um, how do you get out?
item.title: Signs you've come down with a case of 'Zoomxhaustion'

item.dc:creator: Lisa Visentin
item.description: The then NSW Sports Minister Stuart Ayres and his office twice intervened in a sports grants program, which saw millions of dollars in funding allocated to Liberal seats ahead of the 2019 state election.
item.title: NSW minister intervened in sports grants program

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: Players could be forced to take pay cuts as Channel Nine plays hardball with the NRL over how much it is willing to pay in 2020.
item.title: NRL braces for $60m shortfall as broadcasters eye discount

item.dc:creator: Deborah Snow
item.description: Australia's calls for an inquiry into the pandemic have been handled clumsily, warns Australia's first ambassador to Beijing.
item.title: Don't join China COVID-19 'blame game', Gough's man in Beijing warns

item.dc:creator: Julie Power
item.description: Criminals are cashing in on fear and shortages by selling unsafe vaccines, repurposed antivirals - which are in very short supply on the dark web, finds a study.
item.title: Fake vaccines, antivirals and purported cures for COVID-19 on dark web
